sen.j: 上許曾神社（かみこそじんじゃ）は、滋賀県長浜市に鎮座する神社である
sen.e: Kamisoko-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine that exists in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
Kamisoko-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: that existsをlocatedに変更しました。
sen.e: Kamisoko-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 延暦8年、参議橘奈良麻呂が勧請したと伝わる式内社である。
sen.e: It has been transmitted that it is a Shikinai-sha (a shrine listed in Engishiki laws) that Sangi (councilor) TACHIBANA no Naramaro made a request to transfer the deity to new location in 789.
It has been said to be a Shikinai-sha (a shrine listed in Engishiki laws) where Sangi (councilor) TACHIBANA no Naramaro made a request to transfer the deity in 789.
It is a Shikinai-sha (a shrine listed in Engishiki laws) where Sangi (councilor) TACHIBANA no Naramaro is said to have made a request to transfer the deity in 789.

sen.j: 仁寿元年、正六位を賜ったとの記録がある。
sen.e: There is a record that the shrine was given the status of Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank) in 851.
There is a record that the shrine was given the status of Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank) in 851.
There is a record that the shrine was given the status of Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank) in 851.

sen.j: 治承年間に相殿四神を配祀した。
sen.e: During Jishi ear four associated deities were enshrined in the shrine.
During the Jisho era, four associated deities were enshrined in the shrine.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正し、theを追記しました。
sen.e: During the Jisho era, four associated deities were enshrined in the shrine.

sen.j: 明治9年に村社、明治15年に郷社に列格した。
sen.e: The shrine was listed as sonsha (village shrine) in 1876 and in 1882 as gosha (village shrine).
The shrine was listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876 and in 1882 as a gosha (a regional shrine).
sen.cmt: 郷社をa regional shrineとしました。
sen.e: The shrine was listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876 and in 1882 as a gosha (a regional shrine).
